thread.title: Russian airstrikes accidentally kill three Turkish soldiers
thread.title_full: Russian airstrikes accidentally kill three Turkish soldiers

author: Reuters in Ankara
title: Russian airstrikes accidentally kill three Turkish soldiers
text:
Russian airstrikes accidentally kill three Turkish soldiers 
Vladimir Putin calls Turkish leader, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, to express his sorrow and condolences, Turkish military says Turkish soldiers stand guard by the border with Syria. Photograph: Ilyas Akengin/AFP/Getty Images View more sharing options Thursday 9 February 2017 15.23 GMT Last modified on Thursday 9 February 2017 15.37 GMT 
Russian airstrikes have accidentally killed three Turkish soldiers and wounded 11 others in northern Syria, Turkish and Russian authorities have said. 
Turkey’s military said the incident occurred during an operation against Islamic State on Thursday. 
The Russian president, Vladimir Putin, called his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, and expressed sorrow and condolences for the accidental killing, the military added. 
Both parties are investigating the incident, it said. 
Last August Turkey began an unprecedented campaign inside Syria against Isis and Kurdish militia, which initially made rapid progress but has been mired in a bloody battle for the strategic town of al-Bab since December. 
Turkey and Russia have repaired ties that were strained by Turkey’s downing of a Russian jet near the border with Syria two years ago.
